PageTitle: display ipv6 nd packet statistics bridge-domain
FuncDef: The display ipv6 nd packet statistics bridge-domain command displays the number of sent and received ND messages in a specified BD. The display ipv6 nd packet statistics bridge-domain command displays the number of sent and received ND messages in a specified BD. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
CLIs: display ipv6 nd packet statistics bridge-domain [ <bd-id> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays the number of sent and received ND messages in a BD with a specified ID.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
The bd-id value is an integer ranging from 1 to 16777215.

Examples: <HUAWEI> display ipv6 nd packet statistics bridge-domain 10
ExtraInfo: To analyze and verify whether the NS multicast suppression function is normal, run the display ipv6 nd packet statistics bridge-domain command to view the number of sent and received ND messages in a specified BD. If the bd-id parameter is specified, the number of sent and received ND messages only in the specified BD is displayed. If the bd-id parameter is not specified, the numbers of sent and received ND messages in all BDs are displayed.
